Description: Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos, handle and rim missing; on top of mouth: two black bands; on body: black-figure decoration, much worn, consisting of four marching hoplites, to right (nude left leg forward and right leg back, shield on left arm); beneath warriors, two bands, and whirligig on bottom; no filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For similar warriors in dueling action, see CVA Leipzig, Archaologisches Institut de Karl-Marx-Universitat I, 36-7, pl. (668) 28.3-6.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.126) (Phase 1)
